title: Ketanji Brown Jackson Faces More Questions in Supreme Court Hearings
sub_head: The nominee has been pressed by senators over sentences she imposed in criminal cases
body:
WASHINGTON—Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson faced a second full day of questioning from senators on Wednesday, with some Republicans set to further press the Supreme Court nominee over her sentences for convicted criminals, while Democrats hold on to hopes for a bipartisan confirmation vote.
Judiciary Committee Chairman Dick Durbin (D., Ill.) opened the hearing with comments defending Judge Jackson’s record on crime, citing her support from the Fraternal Order of Police and the International Association of Chiefs of Police.
